title: Exact Additive Complements
overview: For infinite A, B ⊆ ℕ with A+B covering all large integers and A(x)B(x) ~ x ('exact' complements), does A(x)B(x) - x → ∞?
conclusion: YES - Sárközy-Szemerédi (1994) proved A(x)B(x) - x → ∞ for exact additive complements. Ruzsa (2017) showed the growth can be arbitrarily slow. Danzer (1964) proved such pairs exist.
references: Ruzsa (2017) - Growth rate can be any w(x) → ∞
